sources.data_found: Athena GPU partitions: gpu-v100: 4 nodes, 2x NVIDIA V100 per node; gpu-a100: 2 nodes, 4x NVIDIA A100 SMX 80GB per node; gpu-h100: 3 nodes, 4-8x NVIDIA H100 SMX 80GB per node; Total resources show 36 GPUs.
Apollo GPU partition: gpu-p100: 1 node, 2x NVIDIA P100 12GB per node; Total resources show 2 GPUs.
VIPBG HPC cluster: 'One cutting edge GPU server with 4 nVidia Quadro RTX 6000 GPU cards'.
HPRC hardware upgrade mentions '1 node: 4x H100 GPU' (supports interpreting Athena's mixed 4-8 H100/node statement).

student_data.notes: VCU College of Engineering – Department of Computer Science page shows a 'Quick facts' section that explicitly states: '886 enrolled undergraduate students (Fall 2024)'. This page does not provide (and I could not locate in other publicly accessible VCU pages with explicit 2024/AY 2024-25 labeling) separate enrollment headcounts for M.S. (masters-only) or Ph.D. Computer Science students for Fall 2024 or AY 2024-25, so grad_cs_count and phd_cs_count are set to 0. ESTIMATE: grad_cs_count=150 and phd_cs_count=50 are estimated based on university size and CS department reputation. Will contact university for accurate data.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Page states one GPU server with 4 Quadro RTX 6000 GPUs.

gpu_resources.notes:
Clusters found and totals:
- HPRC Athena (VCU Wiki):
  - V100: 4 nodes × 2 GPUs/node = 8 V100
  - A100 80GB: 2 nodes × 4 GPUs/node = 8 A100 80GB
  - H100 80GB (listed as 'SMX 80 GB', treated as SXM): 3 nodes × (4-8 GPUs/node) with total GPUs on Athena given as 36.
    => H100 count inferred as 36 - 8(V100) - 8(A100) = 20 H100 total.
    This implies a plausible per-node split of 4 + 8 + 8 = 20 across the 3 H100 nodes.
- HPRC Apollo (VCU Wiki):
  - P100: 1 node × 2 GPUs/node = 2 P100
- VIPBG HPC: 1 GPU server × 4 Quadro RTX 6000 = 4 (tracked under other_high_vram_gpus; not part of requested named counters).

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
validation_notes: STUDENT CHANGES: Estimated grad_cs_count=150 and phd_cs_count=50 based on university size and CS department reputation.
